intro: Spigelia carnosa, commonly known as the showy spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its bright red, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture. Spigelia carnosa is often found in moist, wooded areas and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal use.
